definitions.definition: that has been damaged or injured; no longer whole or working correctly

examples.text: They opened the bag and found a **broken bottle**.
The UN system is broken beyond repair.
His front tooth was broken in half.
One of her patients was a cat with a badly broken leg.
Voters are disillusioned with the government's broken promises.
a single broken white line across the road

definitions.definition: made weak and tired by illness or difficulties

examples.text: He was a broken man after the failure of his business.

definitions.definition: spoken slowly and with a lot of mistakes; not fluent

examples.text: an area of broken, rocky ground

definitions.definition: in a way that keeps repeating a statement or opinion in an annoying way

examples.text: I hate sounding like a broken record, but I have to say again, we must do more to help.
